summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons internal affairs referral and accompanying memorandum regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on August 10, 2019. It details the discovery of Epstein unresponsive in his cell, the emergency response, and admissions from two correctional officers that they failed to conduct required inmate checks (3 a.m. and 5 a.m. rounds) prior to the incident.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York on August 10, 2019, and later pronounced dead. His death is the subject of the incident report.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: A correctional officer assigned to the Special Housing Unit. He was performing CPR on Epstein when the Operations Lieutenant arrived and later admitted to the Operations Lieutenant that he and Officer Noel failed to conduct the required 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts.

persons.name: Tovia Noel
persons.context: A correctional officer who announced the medical emergency. She stated to the Operations Lieutenant that inmate Epstein had hung himself and later admitted that she and Officer Thomas did not complete the required 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. rounds.

persons.name: Operations Lieutenant
persons.context: The BOP supervisor who responded to the medical emergency, witnessed the scene, administered CPR, and later spoke with Officers Thomas and Noel about their failure to conduct rounds. The author of the memorandum.

persons.name: Warden

persons.name: Union President
persons.context: Mentioned by Officers Noel and Thomas as someone they wanted to contact to review any memorandum they would have to write about the incident.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at approximately 6:33 a.m. CPR was administered, and he was transported to a hospital where he was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m.

events.title: Failure to Conduct Inmate Counts
events.description: Correctional Officers Michael Thomas and Tovia Noel admitted to the Operations Lieutenant that they did not conduct the required 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts/rounds on the unit housing Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Internal Affairs Referral Initiated
events.description: Following Epstein's death and the admissions from the officers, a formal 'Referral of Incident' to the Office of Internal Affairs was prepared, alleging 'Inattentive to Duty' and 'Failure to Follow Policy' against Officers Thomas and Noel.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:33 a.m. and was pronounced dead at a hospital at 7:36 a.m.
Two correctional officers, Michael Thomas and Tovia Noel, admitted to failing to conduct the mandatory 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts/rounds on the unit where Epstein was held.
Officer Thomas stated 'we messed up' and 'I messed up' to a supervisor, explicitly taking responsibility for the lapse in protocol.

The incident was formally referred to the Bureau of Prisons' Office of Internal Affairs for investigation, with allegations of 'Inattentive to Duty' and 'Failure to Follow Policy' against the officers.
The officers stated they were traumatized by the incident, wanted to go home, and wished to consult a union representative before writing any official memorandums about the event.
